Was coming from the direction of the church in the dark and it was snowing heavy, suddenly hit the water at about 20mph!

tweets.text:
We’ve issued a new #flood warning for #Bewdley after being made aware the temporary defences at Beales’ Corner have been compromised. 

We’re not aware of any injuries.

We have people on site and are investigating the impacts.

Check your flood risk at: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/RPh2krppaJ

Our team are ready to provide hot meals and non-perishable items to those being affected and evacuated by #StormChristoph

tweets.text: Wet side, dry side, full height #Bewdley #Worcestershire @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/AZLCBdh8kD

Todays sewage discharge on the @RiverChess reminds us we have outstanding issues with @EnvAgency on what happened last year & the nonsense they used to disguise events, let's not start the same this year. Call them what they are, un-permitted sewage discharges. Start your meter.

In sadder news ..the @EnvAgency have started destruction of all hedges behind the flood bank. where we see whitethroats, Lesser Whitethroats, Linnets, just up from where the firecrest was. So called ‘mitigation’ is planned but you can’t replace this. So depressing. New Passage. https://t.co/QM3JTRA3iU
#Bewdley #Severn high flows, barrier doing its job @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency https://t.co/wsh0I5Bwdy

WALLEY’S QUARRY

Yesterday I visited the site with Councillor @SimonTagg and spoke with Red Industries.

There was still major disagreement about the levels and the unpleasantness of the odour produced.

It is now for the @EnvAgency to step up and take action. https://t.co/tjT2fnyUuG
All finished to full height, #Bewdley #Severn side #Worcestershire @WorcsTravel @myworcester @EnvAgencyMids #covidsafe https://t.co/DdrhanglR8

tweets.text: @ROBANDTHEMOB @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency Explains why Environment Agency don’t seem to be acting. What is the solution? It’s a blight on the town. Anyone passing through, seeing the dereliction of Ryecroft then experiencing this awful smell would have a very low opinion of Newcastle-under-Lyme.

tweets.text: #norton #malton #flooding at half past midnight @keanedunk leader of @RyedaleDC gives us an update Listen https://t.co/czrn6rCosf

#StormChristoph - as the rain passes here is the latest on flood impacts we’ve seen - we’re still are in response mode so these numbers will change. Sadly 400 flooded but over 27500 protected. I attach comparison with recent / major floods in England to help calibrate. https://t.co/Df19TtMytY

Thanks to @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 for this video of River Alt at Lunt Meadows. 30 metres of embankment collapsed on Wednesday, saving Maghull from life threatening flooding. Big questions about whether to repair the breach or not as best way to protect against future flooding. https://t.co/noFY7D89n4

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage …

tweets.text: Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency’s flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here’s a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk
@Sue7Russell @DaveThroupEA @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @myworcester No, raising the road surface has meant this can happen, otherwise it would be closed by now Sue

@BorisJohnson @EnvAgency It's Boris the Builder build, build,build,with his one of the lads hairstyle,is Boris the Builder building a new morgue for all the bodies he's collecting,did you guess it then WELL DONE ⚰️⚰️⚰️

tweets.text: @WorcsTravel @DaveThroupEA @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @myworcester Wasn’t raising the road surface meant to stop this from happening

I’m currently in Bronze Command with @SFRS_PDavies and other agencies. We are monitoring the flooding situation in the local area of #Ironbridge We are still receiving calls of people stuck in vehicles. Please DO NOT drive into flood water.  @BBCShropshire @bbcmtd https://t.co/FfpetghfiT

New Road #Worcester is now running as a contraflow system

Many riverside city centre road closures - please follow diversions https://t.co/c896kdY4dQ

In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

tweets.text: @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency Most of your assets including sluices and siphons in this area are totally inoperable after years of neglect. An utter disgrace and yet you patronise by advising what to do in the event of flooding, rather than preventing it.

Extremely important advice from @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd - please take note, and please take care.

#PrepareActSurvive #TeamEA https://t.co/8hXGOE4O4m

Our staff will be on the ground with @NorthYorksFire setting up pumps to reduce the risk of property flooding in #Norton. Please leave space around pumps and the people operating them to stay covid safe.

urls.title: Taskforce sets goal to end pollution from storm overflows
urls.description: New commitments from the water industry aim to increase transparency around storm overflows.

tweets.text:
While #StormOverflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our streets and homes during storms or heavy rain, we want to prevent the damage they cause to rivers and bathing waters.

We’re doing this through the Storm Overflows Taskforce. Read ⬇️ https://t.co/lUoIewlbzi https://t.co/dNbzHWrWuE

New video👇shows Mersey flood gates all but closed. Sale Water Park a good 2-3 m higher as result (see next tweet). The flood gates & Sale WP (hole left by m60 works) did their job for folk! No houses flooded!🙏flood planners! @EnvAgencyNW #flooding #StormChristoph #Chorlton https://t.co/fqFGw8EIjp

Brearley Fields this morning, soon to be wetlands, I can’t wait 😊 it definitely lends itself to a wetlands project After the deluge over the last few days it’s pretty full. Soon it will be attracting some wonderful wildlife @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE #wetlands #nature https://t.co/5jqIDArwrj

⚠️ ALERT ⚠️

⛔️ Tybridge Street #Worcester is CLOSED, Bull Ring roundabout at St John's is open - use Carrington Bridge to cross the river from west to east

New Road open as usual, contraflow system operational in 2 hours https://t.co/OmSUiPYkAn

urls.title: Met Office warns of 'danger to life' from Storm Christoph
urls.description: People urged to brace for floods, gales and snow, with parts of England expecting 200mm of rain

tweets.text: We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

urls.title: Taskforce sets goal to end pollution from storm overflows
urls.description: New commitments from the water industry aim to increase transparency around storm overflows.

tweets.text:
As part of the Storm Overflows Taskforce, we’ve set a goal with the water industry to eliminate harm caused by #StormOverflows.

This includes providing more information to help surfers and swimmers decide when and where to enjoy bathing waters. Read more: https://t.co/DqD6uvP0fe https://t.co/S1j7DAMLfy

Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv
